instructions:
Wash, core and chop or coarse grind vegetables. Mix well with salt, cover and refrigerate overnight.
Drain and let chopped vegetables stand in colander to drain for another 2 hours in refrigerator. Tie the dry
spices in a cheesecloth bag.
In a 4 quart saucepan add the vinegar, sugar, horseradish and spice bag and bring to a boil. Add the
chopped vegetables and again bring to the boiling point, but do not boil. Remove from heat and place pan in
cold water to stop cooking. May be frozen. Makes about 5 cups.
ingredients: 1/2 cup malt vinegar (or 2 cups total cider vinegar)
name: Piccalilli
